radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Layered hyperdense material in the gallbladder suggestive of gallstones; a focal wedge-shaped defect in the left inferolateral kidney.

Bilateral posteromedial fibrosis and pulmonary nodules, 2 to 3 mm in diameter, in the right lung, which were stable compared with previous studies; no evidence of filling defects in the pulmonary arteries or lymphadenopathy.

Bilaterally symmetric paramediastinal sub-pleural reticular opacities in the upper lobes, architectural distortion, volume loss, and traction bronchiolectasis; a solid subpleural pulmonary nodule, 3 mm in diameter, visualized in the right middle lobe.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The pulmonary nodule has been stable since it was observed on CT of the chest 2 years earlier.
